required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Metabolic Fate Modifications of Saturated Fats After an Overfeeding
clinical_study.official_title: Metabolic Fate Modifications of Saturated Fats After an Overfeeding

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre de Recherche en Nutrition Humaine Rhone-Alpe

collaborator.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

clinical_study.source: Centre de Recherche en Nutrition Humaine Rhone-Alpe

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the partitioning of exogenous lipids in the postprandial period while a study of overfeeding. The method is based on the incorporation of a stable isotopic tracer (d31_palmitic acid, d31_C16) in lipoprotein triglycerides (TG-CHYLOMICRON and TG-VLDL) and in free fatty acids (FFA).

detailed_description.textblock: Healthy overweight and lean young men are subjected to an overfeeding during 56 days which corresponds to a supplement of 761 Kcal/day. During two exploration days (before : D0 et after : D56 overfeeding) they have ingested a breakfast with tracer (d31_palmitic acid, d31_C16, 20mg/kg) and blood and urine samples were collected every hour of each exploration day. The enrichment in deuterium was measured by gas chromatography-organic mass spectrometry (GC-OMS) in palmitic acid pool of lipid fractions.

primary_outcome.measure: Post prandial partitioning of exogenous lipids

secondary_outcome.measure: Genes expression in adipose and muscle tissues

intervention.description: 100g per day of cheese + 40g per day of almonds + 20g per day of butter

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 to 55 years old
- BMI 18 to 30 kg/m²
- Stable physical activity
- Safety subject during medical consultation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical or surgical history which may affect energy expenditure (renal -cardiovascular -hepatic- endocrine-inflammatory diseases)
- Drug use that could affect energy expenditure (steroids, nicotine substitutes, thyroid hormones)
- Eating disorder
- Intensive sportive activity
- Subjects who Smoke
- Claustrophobic subjects

overall_official.affiliation: Centre de Recherche en Nutrition Humaine Rhône-Alpes

facility.name: Centre de recherche en nutrition humaine Rhone-Alpes
